thread.title: Universal Orlando announces Fast & Furious themed ride to open in 2017
thread.title_full: Universal Orlando announces Fast & Furious themed ride to open in 2017 | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Universal Orlando announces Fast & Furious themed ride to open in 2017
text:
155 shares 8
View
comments
In the words of Vin Diesel: 'Are we talkin' or are we racin'?'
For visitors of Universal Orlando Resorts, the answer is simple: the park has just announced that a new Fast & Furious ride will open in 2017.
Called Fast & Furious: Supercharged, the attraction promises to take thrill-seeking guests on a high-octane journey through the underground racing world.
Scroll down for videos
Universal Orlando Resorts has announced a Fast & Furious: Supercharged ride to open in 2017
This concept rendering of the attraction show just how up close and personal you can get with the race cars
The ride will, of course, feature stars from the film, including Vin Diesel (Dom Toretto), Dwayne Johnson (Hobbs) and Michelle Rodriguez (Letty) as well as plenty of adrenaline-pumping racing vehicles.
Guests will 'explore the headquarters of Toretto and his team and even get to check out some of the supercharged cars they've seen on the big screen,' the resort said.
RELATED ARTICLES Previous 1 Next North Korea's new international airport boasts chocolate... Grumpy Cat is not waxing lyrical AT ALL about being the... Sick of the British summer? Then sail away with these... Petal power: Portuguese city is transformed by breathtaking... Share this article Share 155 shares It's no surprise that the film is being adapted to a real-life ride given that it's Universal Pictures' highest-grossing film franchise to date.
Unfortunately, to make room for the new, some old attractions are getting axed.
The ride will feature stars from the film, like Vin Diesel (pictured), Dwanye Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez
Guests will 'explore the headquarters of Toretto and his team' and 'check out supercharged cars,' according to a press release
Currently, there is already a Fast & Furious: Supercharged attraction at Universal's Hollywood theme park
Fast & Furious: Supercharged will replace Beetlejuice Graveyard Revue and Disaster: A Major Motion Picture Starring You!
But given that the seven Furious films have grossed nearly $3.9billion (or Â£25billion) worldwide, it's doubtful anyone will mind.
You might not be surprised to learn that this isn't the first Fast & Furious themed ride, either.
Universal Studios' Hollywood unveiled their own Supercharged ride this past June after the film Furious 7 opened earlier in April.
